translated: I lived in a leaf hut;
When Phussa was teaching the Dhamma,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of good deeds.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā saddasaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā saddasaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus have I heard: on one occasion the Venerable Saddasaññaka recited these verses.
The Elder Saddasaññaka’s Story is the eighth.
